titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Indentured servant contract between the Duke of Chandos and one George Harvey, 1761 MS 171
titlestmt.author: Alan Bath

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 17:35:41 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Indentured servant contract between the Duke of Chandos and one George Harvey
did.abstract: The holding consists of an Indentured Servant Contract between the Duke of Chandos and one George Harvey, a parchment document, approximately 23 x 29 inches in size, in English and dated 1761, setting forth the terms of the indenture.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Duke of Chandos as featured in this 1761 indentured slave contract may have been Henry Brydges, 2nd Duke of Chandos (1708-1771) or James Brydges, 3rd Duke of Chandos (1731-1789). No further information is available for Mr. George Harvey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The holding consists of an Indentured Servant Contract between the Duke of Chandos and one George Harvey, a parchment document, approximately 23 x 29 inches in size, in English and dated 1761, setting forth the terms of the indenture.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift from Mr. Ben Wise, at the time a graduate student in History at Rice University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Indentured servant contract between the Duke of Chandos and one George Harvey, 1761, MS 171, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material should be facilitated through the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
